result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyrone K McClarn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tyrone K McClarn is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Tyrone K McClarn was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Tyrone K McClarn was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Tyrone K McClarn was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Completion of certified domestic violence treatment.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

of discharge from commitment.

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Payal Khandhar.  Galen G Strebe and Jessica Miller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Dr. Carr's report concludes defn is now competent at this time to proceed with these criminal proceedings. Defn and Atty Khandhar believe defn is not competent. Atty Khandhar advises she wishes to call defn's girlfriend as a witness. ADA Strebe request witness sequestered from the court room. CT orders defn's witness sequestered. Witness Dr. Carr duly sworn and testified via telephone. Direct exam by ADA Strebe. CT receives Dr. Carr's report into evidence w/o obj for purposes of this hearing. Cross exam by Atty Khandhar. Re-direct exam by ADA Strebe. Witness excused at 4:18 p.m. Witness O. J. duly sworn and testified. Direct exam by Atty Khandhar. Cross exam by ADA Strebe. Witness excused at 4:30 p.m. Argument by Atty Khandhar. Argument by ADA Strebe. CT makes findings and finds defn is competent, and these proceedings may proceed. CT discharges defn from the commitment order and signs order F/W.
to produce

Counsel advised the CH will be contested and will need testimony from Dr. Carr, but Dr. Carr is out of the office from 4/6-4/12. Defn on a PO hold in 15CM559. CT finds good cause to set over CH.  Competency hearing scheduled for April 17, 2018 at 03:15 pm.

paper file destroyed
of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency)

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Payal Khandhar.  Galen Strebe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Dr. Schoenecker concludes defn lacks substantial capacity to understand the court proceedings and assist in his own defense. Defn in agreement with Dr. Schoenecker's report, but Atty Khandhar objects to the conclusion of defn likely to be restored to competency. Dr. Craig Schoenecker duly sworn and testified via telephone. Direct exam by ADA Strebe. Exam by CT. The maximum timeline for defn to regain competency is 12 months-Dr. Schoenecker believes defn will likely regain competency within 12 mo. Cross exam by Atty Khandhar. Re-direct exam by ADA Strebe. Witness excused at 10:23 a.m. Argument by ADA Strebe-defn is not competent at this time, but can be restored within the time period with treatment. State req the defn to committed to an inpatient treatment. Atty Khandhar obj to inpatient treatment if the CT finds the defn be committed. Argument by Atty Khandhar. CT makes findings and finds defn is not competent to proceed, but finds he is likely to be restored within 12 mo with treatment and medication. Parties stipulate to 79 days of credit for 17CT517 and 75 days credit for 17CM2107. CT calls defn case 15CM559 because the ALJ submitted letter requesting competency determination. CT adopts findings from 17CT517 and 17CM2107 into 15CM559, and enters the same order. CT will enter 79 days credit into that order.
from State of Wisconsin/Division of Hearings and Appeals RE Request for a Competency Determination
